George Cunha Cardoso

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/5574773135888267
  • Última atualização do currículo em 13/09/2019

Docente na graduação em Física Médica e na pós-graduação em Física Aplicada a Medicina e a Biologia (FAMB) da FFCLRP, da Universidade de São Paulo. Orienta pesquisa aplicada em óptica biomédica, com foco em técnicas não-invasivas, especialmente envolvendo os sistemas epitelial e cardiovascular. Inventor com 20 patentes internacionais em áreas tais como espectroscopia de gases por imagens e aplicações de eletricidade estática e triboeletricidade. Foi membro eleito do conselho da American Physical Society (NYS) e do comitê de propriedade intelectual da Xerox Research, NY. Lecionou na Adelphi Univ. (NYC) e na Haverford College (Filadélfia). Tem graduação (UFAL, Maceió), mestrado e doutorado (UFPE, Recife) em física e pós-doutorado em fotônica quântica (Northwestern Univ., Chicago). Contato: gcc[arroba]usp.br. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2015 - 2017
Desenvolvimento de Tecnicas Biomedicas usando processamento de video de cameras, speckle e spectroscopia
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (1) .

Integrantes: George Cunha Cardoso - Integrante / Antonio Adilton Oliveira Carneiro - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior - Auxílio financeiro.
2011 - 2012
Low-cost hyperspectral compressive-sensing-imaging using the single pixel camera concept
Descrição: The single-pixel camera (SPC) is a novel concept (2006) to make hyperspectral IR imagers both possible and cheap. It brings ?color? to the IR domain. Goal is to explore novel image processing capabilities with SPC..
Situação: Desativado; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: George Cunha Cardoso - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Xerox Corporation - Auxílio financeiro.
2009 - 2010
Development of Organic Solar Cells
Descrição: The main thrust of this proposal is to develop and benchmark photovoltaic cells with Xerox?s outstanding proprietary photosensitive materials and other potential candidates from current state-of-art materials. We aim to find materials and methods to prepare high performing organic photovoltaic devices. The research activity will include device fabrication and characterization to seek optimal configurations and potential for large scale processing. The generated intellectual property can be put in the R&D pipeline and/or give Xerox a stream of revenue by having an edge in this big business of the future..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: George Cunha Cardoso - Coordenador / Liang-Bih Lin - Integrante / Amanda Preske - Integrante / Krishna Balantrapu - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Xerox Corporation - Auxílio financeiro.
2007 - 2010
Granular Physics of Electrically Charged Particles
Descrição: The objective of this work is the first systematic experimental study of the configuration of charged granular particles deposited on a film, as well as a measurement of the contact forces between particles. In particular we will study the roles of electrostatic charge, substrate charge, film thickness, and particle size. The positions of the particles will be measured using optical microscopy with methods that Dinsmore?s group has developed. From these images, the contact forces will also be measured from the distortion of the particles where they touch one another. With the change of direction of the Xerox business and research away from xerography, granular materials does not seem to be a highly relevant research topic anymore..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) .

Integrantes: George Cunha Cardoso - Coordenador / Anthony Dinsmore - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Xerox Corporation - Cooperação.
2005 - 2006
Lasers, Quantum Optics, Atom Traps & High Resolution Spectroscopy
Descrição: Esforço conjunto do departamento de fisica.
Situação: Desativado; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (4) .

Integrantes: George Cunha Cardoso - Integrante / Joshua Grossman - Integrante / G Rao - Coordenador.
2005 - 2006
Negative-refraction-index for light in atomic vapors
Descrição: The basis of this proposal is the use of coherent light control of an atomic vapor to produce a negative refraction index. As a result, should be possible to create a homogeneous, isotropic medium characterized by a single negative refraction index in the visible range of the spectrum, as opposed to the matrix-like metamaterials and photonic crystals. Though photonic crystals and metamaterials are the right choice for practical applications, they suffer from their intrinsically non-homogeneous character which limit subwavelength resolution. In addition, negative refraction has not yet been demonstrated in the visible range: experiments have been confined in the microwave region due to technical complications of nanotechnology. The experiments to be performed will center around tests of refraction in the induced negative-refraction vapor, imaging properties, and Doppler-effect testing of a negative-refraction moving electromagnetically-induced grating, that is expected to show a reversed sign in the Doppler shift frequency never demonstrated in optics. Overall, two different types of media will be used. The experiments on refraction will take advantage of a very high density hot vapor cell. It has been theoretically shown that negative refraction can be achieved in atomic vapors. For the reverse Doppler effect of moving negative refraction media, cold atoms of a magneto-optical trap (MOT) will be used. Though the effect might be smaller due to the relatively low density of the the MOT (<1014 atoms/ cm3) , the absence of regular Doppler broadening and the existence of ultra narrow resonances (~ 10 kHz) will facilitate the observation and study of reverse Doppler effect..
Situação: Desativado; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: George Cunha Cardoso - Coordenador.
